messages.content: ComfyUI Floodgate is an extension for ComfyUI that allows users to easily control the logic flow by toggling between different paths without reconnecting multiple nodes.
What is the motivation behind developing Floodgate for ComfyUI?

The motivation behind developing Floodgate is to provide a solution for easily switching between different workflows, such as Hires. Fix, without the need to connect and disconnect multiple nodes every time.
How does Floodgate work in ComfyUI?

In ComfyUI, Floodgate works by connecting the output of a node to the source of the Floodgate node, then connecting each path to the desired remaining workflow. Users can toggle between the paths by clicking on the gate_open button.
Can Floodgate handle arbitrary types in ComfyUI?
Yes, Floodgate can connect any arbitrary types in ComfyUI, as long as the input and output types match.
Is it possible to use multiple Floodgates in one workflow in ComfyUI?
Yes, users can have multiple Floodgates in one workflow and control each Floodgate individually in ComfyUI.
At what stage is the logic flow parsed in ComfyUI Floodgate?
The logic flow is parsed during the queuing stage, not the execution stage, in ComfyUI Floodgate.
What should be considered when using boolean values with Floodgate in ComfyUI?

When using boolean values with Floodgate in ComfyUI, the value has to be already determined when pressing Queue Prompt, such as from the toggle or a primitive node. Using a node that outputs a boolean during execution will not work.
